channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Even If the Fed Cuts Rates, Homes Will Still Be Just as Expensive
item.description: The Fed is expected to cut rates next month, but that won't solve affordability problems anytime soon.

item.title: The biggest data breaches in 2024: 1 billion stolen records and rising
item.description: Some of the largest, most damaging breaches of 2024 already account for over a billion stolen records. Plus, some special shoutouts. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ‘Deliberate Indifference’: Court Rulings Challenge Extreme Heat Conditions in Prisons
item.description: “If it’s 103 outside, it may be 107 to -8 inside of your cell,” said a man who worked in the fields while imprisoned in Texas.

item.title: Signs That You May Be Dehydrated
item.description: When you lose more water than you take in, your body struggles to perform its essential tasks. Learn how to tell if you're not getting enough water to avoid dehydration.

item.title: From $17K/Year Teacher Salary to Financial Freedom with Repeatable Rentals
item.description: How does a teacher with a LOW salary achieve financial freedom, let alone invest in real estate? Surprisingly, it’s not as hard as you think, and if you repeat the […]

item.title: Euro VCs welcome Balderton’s fresh $1.3B but grumble about Europe’s AI misses
item.description: In the last 12 months, Balderton has announced 12 new investments. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Tim Walz on Criminal Justice: 5 Things to Know
item.description: Where Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Vice President Kamala Harris’ running mate, stands on policing, guns, prison reform and other issues.

item.title: Short-Term Rental Demand Returns, So Why Are Hosts Making Less?
item.description: A couple of years ago, everyone was expecting an “Airbnbust,” where short-term rental investments would sit vacant, hosts would be forced to sell, and hotels would take the reigns as […]

item.title: TikTok comes for messaging apps with the addition of group chats
item.description: TikTok looks to be taking on popular messaging services like Meta’s WhatsApp and Apple’s Messages, as the company announced on Monday that it’s adding group chats to its platform. You can now create group chats with up to 32 people to chat and share content together. While people often share TikTok videos with each other […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Exposed Police Misconduct. Now They’re Paying a Steep Price.
item.description: Whistleblower laws have advanced in public and private sectors, but protections for police who report illegal or unethical behavior lag far behind.

item.title: What to Do About Cholesterol Issues
How to Use “Asset Management” to Build Wealth (Even with a Small Portfolio!)
item.description: You DON’T need to scale your real estate portfolio to start building wealth. Whether you own a single rental property or one hundred doors, the size of your portfolio isn’t […]

item.title: What is AI good for anyway? Maybe not summarizing
item.description: There’s a fascinating look by John Herrman over at NYMag today at one of the big proposed uses of AI: summarizing content. We all need things summarized, right? Everybody’s too busy and overloaded with information. At least that’s what every tech company doing AI seems to be settling on. The problem is the summaries that […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Drawing Attention
item.description: News Inside Issue 17 features the opinions of justice-affected people on Trump’s felonies, and a nonfiction comic about death penalty mitigation.

item.title: Are EV Chargers the Next Rent-Increasing Amenity?
item.description: Electric vehicle sales are rising. Does it make sense to add an EV charging station at your property, and can you raise rent accordingly?

item.title: Waymo to begin testing driverless robotaxis on San Francisco freeways
item.description: Waymo plans to start testing its fully autonomous vehicles with no human safety driver on freeways in the San Francisco Bay Area this week. Its employees will be the first guinea pigs, and initial testing will start outside rush hour with “less than a handful” of vehicles. For those who didn’t already know, Waymo got […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: These Private Centers Lack Oversight. Cuyahoga County Judges Send Kids Anyway.
item.description: Courts are increasingly sending children to private youth care centers, spending millions while detention center overcrowding persists.
